required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Isokinetic Performance and Function After Total Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Isokinetic Performance and Function Are Similar 12 Months After Total Hip Arthroplasty Applied With a Posterior or Anterolateral Approach: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: There are ongoing debates on the effects of the surgical approach on outcome after total hip arthroplasty. It was hypothesized that with the anterolateral approach, trauma to the abductor arm can be occured and related detrimental effects can diminish the post-operative outcomes. In this first randomized controlled trial in the literature on this subject, isokinetic performance and patient-reported functional outcomes were evaluated in patients undergoing total hip arthroplasty. with a posterior approach (PA) and a anterolateral approach (ALA), at 6 and 12 months postoperatively.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients undergoing total hip arthroplasty are randomized to posterior approach (PA) and anterolateral approach (ALA) groups. The patients are evaluated preoperatively and at 6 and 12 months postoperatively, with flexion, extension and abduction strength measurements and the Harris Hip Score (HHS). The physiatrist performing isokinetic tests and the patients are blinded to the study groups.All data are calculated as mean and standard deviation values. The Student's t-test is used for statistical analysis of the patient data. Statistical calculations are performed using SPSS vn.22.0 software (IBM SPSS Statistics for Windows, Version 22.0. Armonk, NY, USA).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from preoperative isokinetic test results at 6th months and 12th months isokinetic test results
primary_outcome.description: isokinetic test during flexion, extension and abduction of the hip

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from preoperativeHarris Hip Score results at 6th months and 12th months iHarris Hip Score results
secondary_outcome.description: Functional score of the hip. Harris Hip Score: 100-90: Excellent 89-80:Good 79-70:Fair below 70:Poor

arm_group.description: anterolateral surgical approach of total hip arthroplasty
posterior surgical approach of total hip arthroplasty.

intervention.description: two different approaches of total hip arthroplasty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients aged 55 to 80 years unilateral primary hip osteoarthritis -
Exclusion Criteria:
bilateral osteoarthritis inflammatory arthritis post-traumatic osteoarthritis previous hip surgery neuromuscular diseases
